line_1: Her Seat of Empire is the Belly:
line_2: The plainest Man alive may tell Ye,

line_1: With beef and carrots fills his belly;
line_2: Whether the man in't, as some tell ye,

line_1: As old Obesus preach upon his belly,
'T must be the Cholick in your Belly:
line_2: If inward Wind does truly swell Ye,

line_1: She let Him almost burst his Belly:
And Balguy with a bishop in his belly!
line_2: For thee fat Nanny sighs and handy Nelly,

line_1: There was no joking with the belly.
I find the same Gnawing and Wind in my Belly;
line_2: Five Times have I purg'd, — yet I'm sorry to tell ye

line_1: You'd swear he'd wildfire in his belly;
line_2: His words so singe you as they sally,
